title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9003.33 - Bicycling, roller skating, skateboards, roller blades
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9003.33 - Bicycling, roller skating, skateboards, roller blades

State Regulations
(a) Any person bringing a bicycle, roller
skates or roller blades into any park shall obey all park signs pertaining to
the use of such bicycles, roller skates, skateboard or roller blades. No
bicycle, roller skates, skateboard or roller blades shall be ridden, skated, operated or otherwise used on the grass, or on the upper level of the
esplanade, or between the rail and the immediately adjacent benches of the
esplanade, or in any sitting or play area, or playground. Bicycles, roller
skates, skateboards and roller blades may be ridden, skated, operated and used
in the parks, but only at the times, and in the areas, specifically designated
by ParksCorp. No person shall ride, skate, operate or use a bicycle, roller
skates, skateboard or roller blades in a reckless manner. Skateboards shall not
be skated or operated or used on park property, fixtures or equipment in a
manner likely to cause damage or injury to persons or property. (b) Persons operating or using bicycles, roller skates or roller blades shall yield to pedestrians in any part of the
parks. Notes

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
